body_html:
That issue is still present in 1.3.0. This is getting borderline ridiculous. It's been a year and a half now, so it's really time for it to get fixed once and for all.

$ pip install --user --no-cache-dir --upgrade --ignore-installed tensorflow-gpu
[...]
Successfully installed backports.weakref-1.0rc1 bleach-1.5.0 funcsigs-1.0.2 html5lib-0.9999999 markdown-2.6.9 mock-2.0.0 numpy-1.13.1 pbr-3.1.1 protobuf-3.4.0 setuptools-36.2.7 six-1.10.0 tensorflow-1.3.0 tensorflow-gpu-1.3.0 tensorflow-tensorboard-0.1.4 werkzeug-0.12.2 wheel-0.29.0
$ python -c "import tensorflow; print tensorflow.__version__"
[...]
    from google.protobuf import descriptor as _descriptor
ImportError: No module named google.protobuf

$ touch .local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/google/__init__.py
$ python -c "import tensorflow; print tensorflow.__version__"
1.3.0

body:
That issue is still present in 1.3.0. This is getting borderline ridiculous. It's been a year and a half now, so it's really time for it to get fixed once and for all.

```
$ pip install --user --no-cache-dir --upgrade --ignore-installed tensorflow-gpu
[...]
Successfully installed backports.weakref-1.0rc1 bleach-1.5.0 funcsigs-1.0.2 html5lib-0.9999999 markdown-2.6.9 mock-2.0.0 numpy-1.13.1 pbr-3.1.1 protobuf-3.4.0 setuptools-36.2.7 six-1.10.0 tensorflow-1.3.0 tensorflow-gpu-1.3.0 tensorflow-tensorboard-0.1.4 werkzeug-0.12.2 wheel-0.29.0
$ python -c "import tensorflow; print tensorflow.__version__"
[...]
    from google.protobuf import descriptor as _descriptor
ImportError: No module named google.protobuf

$ touch .local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/google/__init__.py
$ python -c "import tensorflow; print tensorflow.__version__"
1.3.0
```
